data.event: In an interview Friday, Roberts would not specify his position at the company, only saying he worked “in management.”
Roberts’ legislation stems from a legal battle that arose in 2005, when Gainesville officials stopped a local modular-home builder from finishing several homes in the city.
Snyder said he was thinking of flying down for debate on the bill last week, but he decided not to because, “I thought this whole thing was taken care of.”
Roberts said he is now trying to change it back in the Senate.
